website_summaries.verdict: DIYers and contractors often need to find more than studs in walls, and this Zircon has that versatility. Good to have around when remodeling, or attaching items to walls. Fast calibration cycle.
pros: Detects center of stud, not just location
Deep scanning mode for thicker or insulated walls
cons: Slight twists during scan can create false readings
Electronics no better than magnetic scanning techniques
Better at finding AC wires than studs

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder for home and DIYer
customer_reviews.text: Money well spent. Bought this because I just recently bought my first home and I have lots of projects, small and big, in mind. With that said, I knew I would need a good stud finder. This thing is amazing! The technology built into, the accuracy of it....all just wow. Even has a built pencil for marking the center and comes with 3 extra pencil refills tucked behind the battery. I do encourage anyone buying this read the manual!!! If you don't then you will miss out on small features that would of made the task simpler or you simply won't know what the beeps and symbols mean.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable stud finder!
customer_reviews.text: I gave this stud finder an honest chance, attempting to use it in many projects and reading countless articles from the manufacturer on how to use it properly. Despite this, I have been completely unable to get a reliable reading, always having to resort to other methods to locate studs. Even when I had cause to tear down a wall, I used the stud finder first to see if it would reveal the layout prior to verifying it. It was so hopelessly wrong that I threw the device in the bin immediately. Do not waste your time or money! P.S. Nothing special or funny about my walls, just drywall on wood studs.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Gielis

customer_reviews.title: I'm forever installing bookshelves 'n such throughout our home. ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm forever installing bookshelves 'n such throughout our home. The house is just over a hundred years old and the walls are plaster and lath, so finding studs, locating power lines, and other little things in the walls is always an adventure. The Zircon Scanner saves me a lot of time...and I don't have to go back to fill in the divots I've left by drilling pilot holes, looking for a stud (sometimes, '16 inches on center' is more 'guess 'n by gosh', than otherwise...did I mention the house is over a hundred years old...?). This is a tool which has found an honored place in my toolbox, to be sure.
customer_reviews.author: TechGeek

customer_reviews.title: meh
customer_reviews.text: I have plaster over gypsum walls. They vary in thickness from about 3/4" to 1 1/4". My old studfinder didn't work at all. This unit works sometimes if you hold your mouth just right, and the wind is blowing gently from the east. If it does find a stud, you better check it a few times to be sure. I was hoping for the money it would work better. I'm sure it would work fine for drywall. What I was really disappointed in though is that the AC detection doesn't even work on my walls. I really didn't think that the wall composition would have much affect on finding wires in the wall.
customer_reviews.author: Robsb123

customer_reviews.title: Absolute Junk. Gives false readings
customer_reviews.text: This device is the worst I’ve ever purchased on Amazon. There is no way it should be rated more than1 star, 2 max. This device gives the most false reading and is not user friendly at all. Trying to find a stud is literally like a needle in a haystack. It will show up that there is a stud under the device but once you scan again to verify There is nothing there. I’ve made so many holes in my walls because the this devise showed that there was a stud beneath. I regret making this purchase and I hope any possible future buyers is aware of this junk. Don’t waste you time or money!!!
customer_reviews.author: SteveB

customer_reviews.title: I was very pleased with how effective this scanner was in detecting the ...
customer_reviews.text: Upon receiving the scanner, I tested it by placing a spare sheet of 10mm drywall over a stud, ac cables and metal bar. I was very pleased with how effective this scanner was in detecting the objects, and the accuracy of the indicated stud-center. The instruction sheet says "This product is intended only for use with an optimum voltage range of 110-127 v.", but it had no trouble detecting my 220-240 v cables. A minor caution: the display has a limited viewing angle and should be viewed at around eye level - if the tool is used too far below eye level the display indicators/bars will look as if they were illuminated when in fact they are not.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great stud finder with many extras
customer_reviews.text: Five stars but one slight issue. The screen is difficult to read if it's held at a severe angle ... anything close to straight it's great. I have to mention an unexpected feature. It has a mode switch that allows for stud, metal, AC/live electric. I didn't expect it to identify live electricity when searching for a stud but IT DOES. Be aware... to find electric wires going overhead to lights... duh... turn the lights ON. Awesome tool... Wish it came with a storage bag...
customer_reviews.author: Dave Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Results were Inconsistent and Arbitrary
customer_reviews.text: I found this scanner to be useless. It never gave the same result twice. I followed the instructions carefully, used a new fresh battery,,etc I admit i have never used a stud scanner before, However, the results were inconsistent and arbitrary. Every time I supposedly found.a stud, if i tried to duplicate the results, the stud would no longer be there, and/or moved a foot to the left or right. Its possible it was defective. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: BEDESQUIRE

customer_reviews.title: Blind as a bat
customer_reviews.text: I actually got it awhile for a job that as I remember did not go well but figured it was me and I just needed more time with it. Fast forward to today and I realize it is not me and this thing is as blind as a bat and as feeble as a 90 year old with issues. I finally dug out a stud finder that I got at least 20 years ago and finished the job so I’m sure it was not me.
customer_reviews.author: FR

customer_reviews.title: By far the best stud finder I've had.
customer_reviews.text: Works great just takes a little getting used to it. I read the a lot of reviews and it sounds like operator error. I read my directions and it works like it's suppossed to. I thought my was broke at first but I was bringing the handle far enough upward. Once I got the hang of it it works excellent. It finds wood studs , metal electrical. I really like this unit a lot. I gave it 4 stars only because of price and how to use it. I do recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: boaalan

customer_reviews.title: Worked great after i reordered
customer_reviews.text: Ok i give 4 stars because i needed to find studs to hang my moose paddles and carribou antlers. I had first stud finder show up sat. And didnt work i was pissed. So i did a reorder and they said it would be in by wed. It showed up tues and worked great!!! I give 4 stars cause first one didnt work or turn on at all. But second one worked awesome! And knowing construction i already knew where the studs were and had an idea where the sprinklers ran and electrical. And it was correct to what i thought.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Nothing fancy -- not worth the extra cost
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice stud finder, but it didn't work any better than the far cheaper one it was replacing. The "center" finding feature is nice, until you run into non-standard studs (e.g., double- or triple-stud, 2.x4 sideways, etc.). The wire finding feature didn't seem to work very well at all, but I didn't give it much of a chance. Overall, this just seemed to try to do too many things, and really didn't excel beyond a basic stud finder at finding the two edges of studs in the wall -- all I really need to do 95% of the time.
customer_reviews.author: okwoodworker

customer_reviews.title: Save your money! Don’t buy!!
customer_reviews.text: Instructions and screen are super easy to read. However, the accuracy is beyond terrible. This thing found more ‘ghost’ studs than actual studs. I’ll just use the old school method of knocking with my knuckles. I guarantee higher accuracy with that method than this handicapped tool.
customer_reviews.author: Clint Roberts

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: The features work very well. Apparently you need fresh batteries everytime you use it, so don't forget to remove them when your done for a while. My biggest complaint is the screen is really hard to see if you're not looking directly at it. The viewing angle is like 15 or 25 degrees. At the right angle it looks like you're always in the center of a stud. AC detection works well and is pretty accurate. Deep scan is nice and has worked over stucco.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I needed a more sensitive device than this
customer_reviews.text: We had a ceiling collapse this summer (foundations in Texas - ugg) and when the contractor replaced the sheetrock they also put a new texture surface on the ceiling and walls. But there was already a layer of texture. And a layer of sheet rock. So to tell if there was a stud under that I needed something that could easily see through an inch of texture and sheet rock. This just didn't have the sensitivity, though in the past I've used this brand, and if it was a normal wall setup this would have been fine for the job.
customer_reviews.author: A Close Reader

customer_reviews.title: Good with a FRESH battery
customer_reviews.text: It works, but only with a FULLY charged NEW battery. If you're having trouble, change out the battery. They really need to install some kind of warning that the malfunction is due to insufficient battery power so that consumers don't waste hours trying to figure out why their stud finder doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: TechDr

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This $50 almost works as well as my 25 year old Zircon. My knuckle works better than either one. This expensive stud finder totally misses a stud that I know is there in a 20 year old sheet rocked wall (that stud is reliably found by my cheap old finder). And when I rescan the entire wall, I get results that vary +/- and inch each time.
customer_reviews.author: David L. Wasley

customer_reviews.title: Not for tile
customer_reviews.text: Bought to find studs behind plaster. Disappointing! Does not work. Do not purchase if you think it’ll find stud or nail in stud behind plaster or tile. Really interested in finding studs behind tile for grab bars. Do yourself a favor, try the magnets for finding studs behind tile. This doesn’t do job!
customer_reviews.author: Tammy D. Tujo

customer_reviews.title: Wow, it works great
customer_reviews.text: It will show both the left and right edge and the center. Does great on double sheetrock thick walls. Very assured you are finding the stud or if you need to AVOID the stud. Works better than others I have tried for the same price but took back because they didn't work as advertised. Very happy with the smooth and easy ability to use this device. The lights and colors help too but I'm more interested in FINDING or purposefully avoiding obstetricals the first time and not hit and miss.
customer_reviews.author: Paul C.

customer_reviews.title: Zircon MultiScanner i520
customer_reviews.text: I was a little disappointed in this when I received it. I have 3 of these back in the USA and they came with a DVD and battery. I am overseas and needed one and paid premium price for it along with import duties. When I saw how it arrived, I was very disappointed in that it was the bare unit without even an instruction booklet or battery. However, this model is still my first pick for getting the job done with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: ... a stud finder and this Zircon is definitely much better. The signal strength indicator helped me a lot ...
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a cheapo version of a stud finder and this Zircon is definitely much better. The signal strength indicator helped me a lot to figure out what was behind the wall as I was getting some weird readings with the old cheapo detector and could not figure out where the studs were. Knowing where the edges are was the reason I bought this one finder. I was able to cut the holes that I needed and it was accurate. The AC line detector is a plus and it warned me about some areas I had to be careful with. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos F.

customer_reviews.title: Great tool. Works better than older models.
customer_reviews.text: Hubby borrowed one of these from a friend, and it worked so well we ordered him one for himself! We like the viewfinder and the multiple settings. I think we have at least 5 different stud finders in our house, all total failures. This one has been “off” once in the last 35 uses. I’m attributing that to user error, not the machine 😉. I love the viewfinder. It’s very clear what’s behind the walls.
customer_reviews.author: Linda A.

customer_reviews.title: not really for Metal
customer_reviews.text: pretty accurate went it comes to finding studs in the wall, however, I purchased to find metal pipes e.g. copper, cast iron etc. could not detect -- tested in areas where I knew metal was behind the wall since I put it their-- this meter could not detect it. works as a stud finder -- would not recommend purchasing for other purposes-diappointing
customer_reviews.author: Ed

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this product
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't say it was successful for the first use, I found a group of metal studs in one location I needed. The edge indicator was off about 3/4 of a inch, the second location it showed a stud and when I drilled a couple little holes to confirm I found a stud there was nothing around for 6 inches. I was using this for metal studs, the AC finder kinda worked also, I was able to locate 1 outlet which was in plain sight, as for tracing the wiring it was a no go. I wouldn't recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P.

customer_reviews.title: It seems right on all the date provided by the this unit and I especially like the middle stud marker that works on wood or ...
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my old Zircon stud finder unit of about 10 years going with this more modern up dated model. It seems right on all the date provided by the this unit and I especially like the middle stud marker that works on wood or metal to know exactly where to center attachments when mounting new items to the wall, ceiling , etc. Equally important it shows where live electrical lines are so you can ad void a "shocking experience" !
customer_reviews.author: Outdoor Man

customer_reviews.title: Must have a new battery to use
customer_reviews.text: You have to have a very good battery for it to work correctly. I took a battery out of another device the first time I used it. It showed over 50% charged so I thought it would be good. Had a hard time getting consistent readings. Latter I got a new battery and got totally different locations for the studs. This time the readings were consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Norm S

customer_reviews.title: Stud cannot be found with this “finder”!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, I thought I was getting a high quality scanner. It did NOT consistently find my studs. Low scans and deep scans; it identified the areas where there were supposed to be studs but there were NO studs!! I ended up doing a bunch of small hole patching and am very frustrated!! I can not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Berns

customer_reviews.title: Very inconsistant, inaccurate, and causes costly damage
customer_reviews.text: You scan to right to left and get a mark, then left to right and get another mark an inch away, then you turn it upside down and redo the above and get far different spots. The metal ducts and electric is weak at best. this is the A250 model. I am shelving a house and this has caused way too much damage. I am now going with the more expensive Franklin ProSensor scanner. It may cost more, but it will save on the mistakes that the Zircon is costing me.
customer_reviews.author: Tribulation ExodusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: A broken used item was shipped as a new.
customer_reviews.text: This item was sent to me as a new and it is a returned item. The audible warning do not work. The laser pointer was scared off to one side. The battery door latch did not work was broken. It was not set an a factory box obviously somebody was trying to pawn off a used item is new.
customer_reviews.author: Larry D Archer Sr.

customer_reviews.title: allmost perfect
customer_reviews.text: everything about this is great, but I do get some odd readings on AC mode. Scanning one wall it pretty much told me i had AC power all over it, what made it scary to try and drill. Turns out there was no AC power at all, but was picking up the insulation as ac power for some reason, On hollow walls it worked perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Zigma

customer_reviews.title: Super easy and accurate.
customer_reviews.text: Works very well. Can essentially map a stud from end to end and locate the center of the stud. Only drawback is the the AC detector is so sensitive it seems to confuse the scanner even if no electrical lines are within 6 inches of the stud. I think the manual states something about detecting AC within 12 inches of a live wire, so I recommend multiple scans in a small area to really map a stud.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Effectiveness Varies
customer_reviews.text: Depending on the type of wall plaster/drywall and its thickness, the device can really struggle; often giving incorrect positions. I expected a lot more from the top-of-the-line product. If you are in relatively new construction, or a home owner trying to hang a picture frame, you're probably going to be fine; but as someone using the product often, it can be a real pain in the butt.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander Stone

customer_reviews.title: DOES NOT WORK!
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in this product. I use a studfinder regularly and decided I wanted a better one so I purchased the Zircon A250 to locate studs and possibly other features in the wall. It fails in its most basic function, finding studs. It rarely flags a stud no matter what wall and where, things my old Stanley finds just fine. Oddly enough the pipe and electrical find features works OK.
customer_reviews.author: CDP

customer_reviews.title: Still figuring out how to get it to work like it did on the video
customer_reviews.text: Still figuring out how to get it to work like it did on the video. It's big and bulky, awkward to use and I'm not sure it even works right. I wish that I had got my act together and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: sjlcnm

customer_reviews.title: The Best
customer_reviews.text: It's well made tool and has a bright screen to read. Iv'e tried a number of different stud finders and this one is simply the best, and accurate. It has a range of features for finding studs, wood, metal, A/C etc. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Jo

customer_reviews.title: My house is a patchwork of modern drywall and studs and old plaster so using this is only slightly better than guessing and knocking
customer_reviews.text: I assume it's mostly my 1912 house's fault and not the device but it has trouble finding studs. My house is a patchwork of modern drywall and studs and old plaster so using this is only slightly better than guessing and knocking. I mostly use it as a double check to make sure there are no wires but as long as you're not right over an outlet you're probably ok.
customer_reviews.author: John M

customer_reviews.title: The most annoying thing was that there was no indication on the ...
customer_reviews.text: This item arrived as promised but it did not work. The most annoying thing was that there was no indication on the battery compartment as to what type of battery to install. Once I figured that out usually, most electronic devices have a small icon that shows the direction of the battery installation including polarity. Not so in this case and a bit baffling to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: Andy Amazons

customer_reviews.title: Good product, wish it came with a case
customer_reviews.text: It does what it's suppose to do. For the price, I wish it came with a case or something to keep it safe. It's extremely handy to have the marker on it. Makes the job easier. Overall, I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Can’t go wrong with this model
customer_reviews.text: I had an older model and needed one to leave at another location so I chose the same company and a later model. It works very well and I don’t have any issues with it, seems accurate
customer_reviews.author: ERIK

customer_reviews.title: Unambiguous .intuitive.
customer_reviews.text: I have other Stud Finders but this was much more accurate,consistent and easier to read than ny of the others. Yes, it is expensive but consider the cost of accidentally nailing into a copper water pipe before you settle for a cheaper/less effective one. Any Stud Finder that gives ambiguous readings is a potential disaster .This one was better than the other 3 I compared it with.
customer_reviews.author: CA Central Coaster

customer_reviews.title: IT WORKS
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product alarm that comes up when at center of stud handy, only one problem that it doesn’t come with case so buy it when you get this item or else every time stud finder bends to straight wall it auto on so it would waste battery if u forget to completely turn it off... GET the CASE over all love this item!!
customer_reviews.author: Vic

customer_reviews.title: Try on before you buy them!
customer_reviews.text: I wouldn't recommend this out of many times I used it to scan for studs it doesn't seems to do such a good job I would say that you have better chances of getting a better one than this one.
customer_reviews.author: DD

customer_reviews.title: It Works! I have been using this device over ...
customer_reviews.text: It Works! I have been using this device over the last several weeks to find studs for hanging TVs, gym equipment, and other types of wall mounts. It even warns you if there are nails or other metal obstructions.
customer_reviews.author: Water Lover

customer_reviews.title: "Occasionally" Finds Studs
customer_reviews.text: I spent allot of money on this to reduce frustration finding studs. I still find myself jamming an ice pick through the drywall to confirm stud locations.
customer_reviews.author: Gary

customer_reviews.title: It worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: I only used it one time to locate studs for a TV wall mount and it worked. Worth the money to secure a 50 inch TV on the wall and not split the wood. One time was great. Will update if something changes
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: Not accurate
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this stud finder and was sadly disappointed. It kept registering studs in areas but when drilled in no wood was found. In the end the CH Hansen magnetic stud finder out performed this item. I would not buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Renius76

customer_reviews.title: ... on several home projects and think it does a good job. The stud centering indicator is very useful ...
customer_reviews.text: I've used the Zircon 68314 on several home projects and think it does a good job. The stud centering indicator is very useful and I would recommend the product if you're in need of a stud finder.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: It's not always as precise as I would like so I usually run it over the same spot ...
customer_reviews.text: It's not always as precise as I would like so I usually run it over the same spot a few times just to be sure I don't get a wrong reading. Still it seems to work well enough for my purposes and the AC detection is great.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Very accurate!
customer_reviews.text: This device is awesome as all 3 detectors are installed in one unit. Very pleased with the results and would definitely recommend its purchase!
customer_reviews.author: dan jaynes

customer_reviews.title: Used better, used worse....
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't able to locate studs through double layer of 5/8 rock. Even in deep scan mode. Running base trim you kind of have to hold the finder upside down. At an angle you can't read the display. Thankfully the red beam tells you where the center of the stud is without needing to see the screen. The battery cover likes to fall off way too often.
customer_reviews.author: Walter B.

customer_reviews.title: Finds studs
customer_reviews.text: This device finds studs and electrical wires and wasn't too expensive. I haven't found any inconsistencies, it's been dead on when compared to measuring 16" between studs. Sometimes if you start measuring from on top of a stud it gets confused, but it's pretty clear when that happens. Just make sure to take a few readings from a few different places, I've found it very consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas B.

customer_reviews.title: It defintely finds the studs, but if you try ...
customer_reviews.text: It defintely finds the studs, but if you try to locate the same stud a few times, it will find the center off each time. So not really sure what is true center, but it works.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jamison

customer_reviews.title: This Scanner is worth the purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I really like the wall mark feature and the accuracy of locating the studs and other utilities behind the wallboard. It comes ready to use with laser and sound for precision. No issues here!
customer_reviews.author: Earthboy57

customer_reviews.title: Display needs work, does the job. Like the stud center finder.
customer_reviews.text: Noob diy'er here. I'm not impressed with it's display. Your eyes have to be at level with the display or you can't see what's going on because of the polarization effect of it's LED display. Does the job though. Happy to see the stud center assist.
customer_reviews.author: Shruti

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work even with new battery!!!! Returned
customer_reviews.text: Not impressed!!! Put new 9 volt in as soon as it came. Next time I tried to use on the project I bought it for wouldn't even turn even after I put another new battery in it. RETURNING IT : (
customer_reviews.author: customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product....
customer_reviews.text: So far I only used my stud finder once, but it gave me the exact location bar none. Great quality, well designed, perfect s/h...but did not come with a Battery. Overall, Great Buy though!!
customer_reviews.author: Uncle Cee

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, works every time and zero issues with operation.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Cerises

customer_reviews.title: NOT Accurate Device
customer_reviews.text: Most expensive Stud Finder Zircon Makes and the MOST inaccurate of all I ever tried. After missing 4 studs on our project and punching holes everywhere, we returned the 'Stud Finder'...Don't Waste Your Money!
customer_reviews.author: GAB

customer_reviews.title: Best stud/elect finder on the market for under $80.
customer_reviews.text: Best stud/elect finder on the market for under $80. My last Zircon finally gave out after 20 years of use, can't beat that.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Hamer

customer_reviews.title: value for the money
customer_reviews.text: I am a DIY individual. The technology this unit has, makes it easy to do a better job around the house.
customer_reviews.author: Rosa Magana

customer_reviews.title: On Off button should be permanent On Off  not  hold for On
customer_reviews.text: IMO the hold on button is a pain if you have joint issues (arthritis) or not Its not too bad on vertical flat wall. However when using on ceiling holding it above head and walking along scaffold board makes it very difficult to use having to keep finger or thumb on button Looking at using a terry clip or something to hold in on position. The screen viewing angle is poor you have to have it directly in line of your eye site Other than that fine found joist etc .
customer_reviews.author: Withchips

customer_reviews.title: Actually works better than I had anticipated
customer_reviews.text: Actually works better than I had anticipated. Never had a false positive, and always tells me where the studs are. I know ... that's it's job. I'm just saying that I didn't expect it to do it's job all that well and ... hey, it does.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent readings through double 5/8" drywall
customer_reviews.text: Provides inconsistent readings when attempting to find studs through double 5/8" drywall even in deep scan mode. This is disappointing since I bought it specifically for the deep scan feature.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A.

customer_reviews.title: It found it's way to me, so it works.
customer_reviews.text: It finds studs, and does it fairly accurately. It's not top of the line, but it's definitely not junk either. Decent tool.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Birkemeier

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: Accuracy for wood studs under drywall is good, other modes are not as accurate (did not "see" a Power trunk line in 1 wall. and was about 50/50 on copper water lines
customer_reviews.author: Kevin M. Forrest

customer_reviews.title: found studs easy/ electric just as easy. I have some plaster walls and found studs ...
customer_reviews.text: works very well, found studs easy/ electric just as easy. I have some plaster walls and found studs every time love the spotlight pointing,easy to mark centers. Best scanner I ever had compared to cheaper models. Easy to read symbols,electric warning on studs. Would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John G.

customer_reviews.title: Does it all! Easy to use!
customer_reviews.text: This does it all! It’s easy to use! I returned the one I had bought fromTarget. This is fantastic! Highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Hayley

customer_reviews.title: Too many false readings
customer_reviews.text: I tried to hand two tv wall hangars. One wall read fine. The second wall (next to a bathroom) gave me so many false readings I had to revert to knocking on the wall and using a nail.
customer_reviews.author: TrendyShopper

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS!!!! made hanging my tv and shelving a breeze, love the replacement tips in the back. This was a great buy! package came quickly and properly protected in the packaging. would buy again!
customer_reviews.author: Andrew E.

customer_reviews.title: Best way to find the middle of a stud
customer_reviews.text: This product works. It eliminates the need to guess where the center to the stud is. Each time I have used it I had no problem drilling or inserting a screw into the studs.
customer_reviews.author: David M. Gage

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes takes multiple scans of the area to get a reading
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use but gave confusing readings at times. Found many times that all lights would stay on then none would come on.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Good, but weak detection
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my years old Black and Decker, this seems a bit weak. Not completely gimmicky with all the options and settings, but surely a little. Not as precise as I expected it to be.
customer_reviews.author: Sholokov

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cost
customer_reviews.text: This product is garbage. Unreliable. I drilled several holes to what was so called center and nothing but dry wall. Don’t waste your money. Get a magnetic stud finder for cheaper.
customer_reviews.author: Brian E.

customer_reviews.title: Good stud finder
customer_reviews.text: Used it a few times haven’t had any issues with it
customer_reviews.author: eesio

customer_reviews.title: Best stud finder
customer_reviews.text: This is by far the best stud finder I’ve used! It’s accurate and the laser makes it easy to mark studs.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent measurement results
customer_reviews.text: Results inconsistent. Often overshot the stud. A similar product, which I received for free a few years ago, was much more accurate and consistent.
customer_reviews.author: Maryfran

customer_reviews.title: $70 wasted. Most of the time it don't work and ...
customer_reviews.text: $70 wasted. Most of the time it don't work and a few times it does so you don't know if it is right or not. Most of the time it don't read anything. I need to return it and hope to.
customer_reviews.author: Virgil HEllyer

customer_reviews.title: gives you a precise readout of inaccurate results
customer_reviews.text: It tells you exactly where the center of the stud is - even when there is no stud there at all. Used on regular drywall, it indicated a stud running next to tile on the wall, but there was no stud there. Perhaps it was fooled by the presence of the tile, but I was measuring next to the tile, not on it.
customer_reviews.author: guy123

customer_reviews.title: Ehh it's okay
customer_reviews.text: Use it for the first time yesterday it does locate the beam however, the accuracy isn't the spot (locating middle of beam). If you decide to buy this I would suggest to take a few scans over the same beam for consistency purposes.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Sourial

customer_reviews.title: Safety is Worth The Cost
customer_reviews.text: Worked Great and saved me a lot of frustration trying to make sure I made the first Cut into my drywall the right cut. Great tool and I recommend it highly. All three functions WORK!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: neat
customer_reviews.text: neat design but it wont find studs on an outside wall from the exterior. i think their more expensive model will. but the internal pencil thing is neat though i cant imagine finding refills.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Accurate
customer_reviews.text: Works really well but disappointed with the battery cover as it fits loosely and occasionally falls off.
customer_reviews.author: Jiffy

customer_reviews.title: The built in pen is so cool. Hit the button and it marks the beam ...
customer_reviews.text: Was able to accurately detect the beams in my lathe and mortar walls from the 1920s. The built in pen is so cool. Hit the button and it marks the beam for you.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: this is a great item. Works fantastically
customer_reviews.text: Although a bit pricy, this is a great item. Works fantastically. Finds the center of wooden or metal studs quickly. Highly recommend this product and seller
customer_reviews.author: David S Samp

customer_reviews.title: Expensive
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work ok. Debating whether worth the cost compared to other models though.
customer_reviews.author: DTT

customer_reviews.title: Expensive and does not do the job as expected. ...
customer_reviews.text: Expensive and does not do the job as expected. Too many hits and misses to make this an accurate and safe tool to use. Remember this advertises that it finds both metal and wood studs and ELECTRIC. Not happening.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Women can do it
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman who does the fix it jobs in this marriage. This is a GREAT tool to find the studs. It worked even on Plaster. The older houses have plaster, not drywall
customer_reviews.author: Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Get something else.
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work very well. Was spotty with the stud finder. Get yourself a magnetic stud finder for 5 bucks. Worked way better than this did.
customer_reviews.author: Devlin

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husbands birthday. He loves it says it’s easy to use and very accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Debbie Lindert

customer_reviews.title: Works well, never miss a stud again.
customer_reviews.text: With backlit screen this unit is easy to read in low light conditions. Finds the studs and ac power as claimed with good accuracy.
customer_reviews.author: mike j

customer_reviews.title: This gadget really works. Made my job real easy.
customer_reviews.text: I used this product to fix all my heavy furniture onto the the wall studs in a high risk earthquake area. I lost too much from the last shake and I don't intend to lose the new furniture I installed for Christmas 2019.
customer_reviews.author: uroco

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste money in the cheap ones
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal of stud finders. Don't waste money in the cheap ones, those won't find anything and will beep even when there's nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Fede S.

customer_reviews.title: Great for newbies
customer_reviews.text: Maybe I'm just old and set in my ways, buy I liked the older models that were much simpler. This one is finicky in some circumstances, but has good detection.
customer_reviews.author: MARK A. DESALVO

customer_reviews.title: Hit or Miss
customer_reviews.text: Little bit hit or miss searching for studs behind drywall. Will not penetrate bathroom tile.
customer_reviews.author: Howard Mclaren

customer_reviews.title: Accurate!
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my husband to use around the house and he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Joan Mallard

customer_reviews.title: studs!
customer_reviews.text: work as described and very easy to use. put the battery in and start scanning by selecting the switch on the scanner.
customer_reviews.author: Ni Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Does not consistently identify studs properly
customer_reviews.text: was way off identifying studs. sometimes would identify a stud but after marking and drilling the stud, according to the finder, would be 2 inches over to he left of right. would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Went through 1 1/2 plaster board, plaster and drywall. Showed the wood holding it up on the cieling. Dropped in 6 can lights
customer_reviews.author: bgbytoys

customer_reviews.title: Good Stud Finder!
customer_reviews.text: I love this, it finds the stud spot on, easy to figure out for amateurs like myself. Battery lasts and it’s easy to read the screen.
customer_reviews.author: SY214Top Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Will not work with plaster walls
customer_reviews.text: Saw some reviews of this item claiming it will work through lath and plaster walls. Would not work at all on my plaster. Switched to metal to identify the nails and still did not detect anything. Might work great on drywall but will be useless if you own an older house.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan K.

product_meta.title: Zircon MultiScanner i520- Center Finding Stud Finder with Metal and Live AC Wire Detection
product_meta.description: Style:i520 Backlit DisplayThe Zircon MultiScanner i520 center finding electronic wall scanner quickly and easily locates studs, detects metal, locates live, unshielded AC wires. Complete with the latest technology in density detecting software and circuitry, as well as an ergonomic body design. Unlike other wall scanners and stud finders, the Zircon i520 stud finder has a 4-mode switch makes it easy to change functions while the ultra-bright LCD screen, SpotLite Pointing System, and audio tone all indicate the location of the target. This Zircon stud finder also comes equipped with a Signal Strength Indicator helps to distinguish between shallow and deep targets. A weak signal can also imply other non-stud objects, like wires and pipes, are present in the area being scanned. The MultiScanner i520 includes ACT (Auto Correcting Technology) that automatically corrects common user errors, such as when scanning begins over a stud, in addition to a low battery indicator to alert its users to replace its battery for optimal performance results. The tool constantly scans its surroundings and recalibrates itself if necessary. In StudScan mode, the Zircon i520 locates the center, edges, and direction of wood or metal studs up to 3/4 (19 mm) of an inch deep. Switch the i520 stud finder over to DeepScan mode and double the scanning depth to 1.5 inches (38 mm) deep and enables scanning for joists in some ceilings and floors. Metal Scan mode of the MS i520 provides the ability to locate non-ferrous metal, such as copper pipes, up to 1.5 inches (38 mm) deep and ferrous metal, such as rebar, up to 3 inches (75 mm) deep. Using Metal Scan mode, this Zircon studsensor can find studs behind lath and plaster walls, tile, drywall and stucco walls by identifying the consistent pattern of screw or nail heads in the studs. Additionally, the MultiScanner i520 is programmed with a WireWarning Detection feature that indicates the presence of live unshielded electrical wires up to 2 inches (50 mm) deep when using the stud and metal scan modes. To detect, locate, map, and trace the live wires, simply switch over to the AC Scan function which acts as a live wire detector and finds and traces live, unshielded AC wiring up to 2 inches (50 mm) deep. The Zircon MultiScanner i520 is a perfect choice for serious users, such as home improvement hobbyists and professional contractors. With the Zircon MS i520, you can safely maneuver through the most complicated of projects with the professional confidence that comes from owning a Zircon.
feature_bullets: Zircon's MS i520 is a multi-surface scanner with 4 modes that detect studs, metal and live AC wiring to help you easily find studs and avoid hazards

Both StudScan and DeepScan modes locate the edges, center and direction of wood or metal studs; Metal Scan mode finds both non-ferrous metal (such as copper pipe) and ferrous metal (such as rebar); AC Scan finds and traces live, unshielded electrical AC wires
WireWarning Detection indicates the presence of live, unshielded electrical AC wiring while scanning in StudScan, DeepScan, and Metal Scan modes
ACT (Auto Correcting Technology) automatically corrects common user errors, such as when scanning begins over a stud, while the Patented SpotLite Pointing System clearly indicates the target location
One fully charged 9V battery, not included, is required for the multi-surface scanner to run at optimal performance
